string-array.item: Baseball (English: baseball) is a sport played by two teams. this sport similar to a baseball game. Thrower (pitcher) from the throwing team trying to throw ball called a baseball, while the players (batters) from the batting team are trying hit the ball with a bat (bat). The team that threw attempted catches the ball hit by the hitting team so that the hitting team turns into the throwing team. The hitting team scores points by running in opposite directions clockwise to return to home plate after touching the markings on the surface a baseball field called the base. Baseball is also known as hardball for distinguishes it from softball.

Badminton, badminton, or clapping feathers (English: badminton) is a sports that use a tool that is round in shape with cavities in it the beating part. And has a handle. This tool is known as a racket played by two people (for singles) or two pairs (for doubles) mutually opposite. Similar to tennis, badminton aims at hitting a feather game ball parry, namely how come (shuttlecock) through the net so that it falls on the opponent's playing field determined and try to prevent the opponent from doing the same.

Basketball or basketball is a team sport in which two teams, usually each consisting of five players, facing each other on a rectangular court, compete with the primary objective of shooting a basketball (approximately 9.4 inches in diameter (24 cm)) through the back hoop ( an 18-inch (46 cm) diameter basket is installed 10 feet (3.048 m) to the boards at each end of the court, while preventing the opposing team shoot through their own ring. Field goals are worth two points, unless scored from behind the three-point line, when it's worth three. After the infraction, it's game time stops and the player who committed the foul or was appointed to shoot the foul a technical is awarded one, two or three one-point free throws. Team with points most at the end of the game wins, but if the regulation game ends with score draw, additional period of play (extra time) is required.

Bowling or rolling ball is a type of game and sport whose activities are just roll the bowling ball with one hand until it hits the pin ten triangles. If all the pins are dropped in one roll (throw) then it is called a strike. If the pin is not dropped at once it is awarded one more chance to knock down the remaining pins. When on the second toss no more pins left is called spare. If after two times there is still a pin remaining, it is called an open frame (missed), the whole of which will determine calculation of the numbers obtained in each game. Pins will be re-ordered as back for the next frame.

Cycling or Cycling, also when using a two-wheeled bicycle, is called cycling or cycling, is the use of bicycles for transportation, recreation, sports. Person those involved in cycling are referred to as "cyclists". Apart from bicycles two, "cycling" also includes riding unicycles , rickshaws , quadricycles , recumbent and similar human-powered vehicles (HPVs). Bicycles were introduced in the 19th century and now number about one billion worldwide. They are a means of transportation in many parts of the world, especially in the densely populated cities of Europe. Bicycle widely regarded as the optimal effective and efficient mode of transportation for short to medium range.

Golf is an outdoor game played individually or in teams compete to put the ball into the holes in the field with the number as few hits as possible. The ball is hit using a set of bats called a club (golf club). The cardinal rule in golf is "play a ball with the golf club from the tee area (teeing ground) into the hole with one or more strokes according to the Rules".

Running or Running is a terrestrial locomotion method that allows humans and other animals move swiftly on foot. Running is a type of gait which is characterized by an aerial phase in which all feet are on the ground (even though there is exception). This is in contrast to walking, where one foot is always touching with the ground, most of the legs are kept straight and the center of gravity vaults over horse legs or legs with reverse pendulum style. Characteristics of the body that runs from an angle point of view of spring-mass mechanics is that the change in kinetic and potential energy in one step occurs simultaneously, with energy storage carried out by the tendons suppleness and passive muscle elasticity. [3] The term running can refer to a variety of speed from jogging to sprinting.

The most popular sport in the world, football, has two different names in languages England, "football" and "soccer". "Football" is used by the British and the majority world population, as well as FIFA. Whereas "soccer" specifically is only used by the people of the United States of America (US). Actually Australia also uses the phrase "soccer" for the nickname of the national football team, the Socceroos. Uniquely, the football organization Kangaroo Country actually uses the phrase "football" â€”Football Federation Australia (FFA). So why are there two different terms for football in English? So, in the early 1800s, a group of British universities played the same game called "football". However, the game and rules are one university with the other others are not uniform. That's why the mention of the game is in English too varies, depending on the category of the game. One variant that emerged was "rugby football" because the game is also done by hand. As for the other variants called association football, shortly after the FA was formed in 1863.

Swimming or swimming is an individual or team racing sport that requires the use of one entire body to move in water. Sports take place in the pool swimming or open water (for example, in an ocean or lake). Competitive swimming is one of the most popular Olympic sports, with running numbers which varies in butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke, freestyle and medley individual . As well as these individual events, four swimmers may take part in the freestyle relay or medley. The medley relay consists of four swimmers each will swim a different style, sequenced as backstroke, stroke breaststroke, butterfly and freestyle.

Table Tennis or table tennis, also known as ping-pong and whiff-whaff, is a sport in which two or four players hit a lightweight ball, also known as a ball ping-pong, back and forth across the table using small compact rackets. Game takes place on a hard table divided by a net. Except for initial service, The rules are generally as follows: the player must let the ball be played towards they bounced once on their side of the table and had to put it back so it bounced on the opposite side at least once. A point is scored when a player failed to return the ball according to the rules. Play fast and demand quick reactions. play the ball changes its trajectory and limits the opponent's options, giving a huge advantage to bat.

Tennis is a racquet sport that is played individually against one opponent ( singles ) or between two teams of two players each ( doubles ). Each player uses a tennis racket strung with string to hit the ball hollow rubber covered with felt over or around the netting and into opponent's field. The aim of the game is to move the ball in such a way so that the opponent cannot play a valid return. Players who can't legally returning the ball will not earn any points, while the opposing player will earn points.
